import { Container } from '../../style'; const ProspectiveTeachers = () => { return (

What do we offer teachers?

We offer a platform for teachers to train themselves in virtual education and showcase their teaching skills in a global setting to:

  • Get US exposure for training and career opportunities
  • Solicit and exchange ideas with US educators and school
  • Qualify for teaching certification in the United States
  • Access local and international communities of learners
  • Collaborate with education professionals around the world

 

What classes can I teach?

You can teach anything you want! As long as you are passionate and knowledgeable about what you want to teach, we will do our best to support you. You can also look around our{' '} website {' '} to find inspiration from other classes.

 

What can I earn?

You will earn 70% of the payments for your class. That being said, you will be the one to price your classes and you can experiment which pricing works best.

 

Do I have to pay to teach?

You don’t have to pay us anything to teach at Tagpros! Just bring your passion and expertise and we will be happy to provide you with our services.

 

Can I promote classes sold elsewhere here?

No. We want to provide the learners with classes that our partnered teachers have created; thus, we will only allow the promotion of classes from our website.

 

Time Zones

Upon creation, you will be the one to set the timezone of the class. Then that class will be viewed on the class catalog depending on the user's IP address and timezone. We recommend that you check the time zones of different countries that could have enrollments to know which time slots will work best for your class.

 

Can companies and organizations teach at Tagpros?

Yes! All institutions are welcome to teach on Tagpros. You can also partner with us to enroll your students in some of our classes. You can learn more about teaching or registering as an organization and apply at csmanansala@tagpros.org.t could have enrollments to know which time slots will work best for your class.

 

Who can teach? How do I get started?

See our guide to{' '} becoming a teacher {' '} on Tagpros.

); }; export default ProspectiveTeachers;
